general_info.summary: This document outlines various academic and administrative programs and resources at Sharda University, including its schools (Dental Sciences, Medical Sciences & Research, Nursing Science & Research), examination reports, academic initiatives like the Academic Bank of Credits and curricula feedback, university publications such as brochures and perspective plans, information on leadership and history, statutory bodies, tenders, and legal documents. It also highlights student support services like counselling, skill enhancement programs, and entrepreneurship initiatives, alongside media outlets like FM Radio, practical guidelines for students (visa, insurance), and information on international campuses and specific courses.

admission_requirements.summary: The SUAT 2025 sample papers are for global knowledge seekers, outlining eligibility criteria for national students which include 60% marks in Matriculation and Sr. Secondary (10+2) with specific requirements for PCM/Computer Science/PCB and a minimum of 50% in Maths, with no gap between 10th and 12th grade. Admission is based on the SUAT online test followed by a personal interview, or an All India JEE Rank up to 3 Lakh. International students require a minimum of 50% in their qualifying examination and relevant pre-requisite subjects. The text also mentions a career path in Computer Science as a Lecturer and encourages taking the next step in an engineering career.
admission_requirements.raw_content:
SUAT 2025
Sample Papers
• Sample Papers
Global Knowledge Seekers
• Global Knowledge Seekers
For National Students: Matriculation with-60% marks Sr. Secondary (10+2) 60% marks (Aggregate) & minimum 60% marks in PCM Computer Science/PCB for Biotechnology without gap between 10th and 12th.
Minimum 50% marks in Maths
SUAT (Online Test) Followed by Personal Interview
JEE All India Rank upto 3 Lakh
For International Students: The eligibility criterion for all programs for international applicants is minimum 50% in the qualifying examination and having studied the pre-requisite subjects for admission in to the desired program.
• Matriculation with-60% marks Sr. Secondary (10+2) 60% marks (Aggregate) & minimum 60% marks in PCM Computer Science/PCB for Biotechnology without gap between 10th and 12th.
• Minimum 50% marks in Maths
• SUAT (Online Test) Followed by Personal Interview
• JEE All India Rank upto 3 Lakh
